page.title: 17PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: PRIMARY SCHOOL STAUNTON ON WYE The endowed primary school is housed in a rather large rambling victorian building owned by the Jarvis Trust. The LEA maintain the interior and the Trust the exterior building. The school numbers about 30 pupils but has had up to 100 pupils. The children aged rising 5 - 11 are divided into 2 classes, infant and junior with a teaching head and assistant teacher. Pupils come from the village and surrounding parishes. A flourishing voluntary-run playgroup meets in the redundant school kitchen 3 mornings a week, taking children from 3-5 with one parent helping the organisers. The group has raised money to buy equipment and a charge of 80p per child helps to cover expenses.
